page.title: 16Change-N.Wingfield 1945-85 B
page.content: {People} There used to be a great sense of community especially among terrace dwellers.Summer evenings were spent in allotment gardens or gossiping in the backyard while children played street games.Families often walked out together in the evenings;in winter,they listened to the wireless and played indoor games together.Most children attended Sunday School; many,who went to the Methodist Chapels,had the Anniversary as a special treat.We now have Community Centres but not the same degree of neighbourliness.Evenings are spent watching T.V.,in the local pub,going out in cars,or playing Bingo in the local clubs.Street games have been replaced by aggressive, disorganised behaviour,and there is a plethora of graffiti.{J.D.Fisher}
